intro: Ouratea vulgaris, commonly known as the Brazilian beauty or the white star tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy green leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Ouratea vulgaris is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
